titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jim Grimsley Papers, 1970-2018 and undated RL.00483

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection includes Grimsley's personal journals, personal and professional correspondence, handwritten notebooks containing the creative beginnings of his novels and plays, drafts of of his writings, publicity, reviews, and publications by or about him in small magazines. Also includes published copies and translations of his writings.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: As of 3/25/2016, all papers are open to use.
Original audiovisual materials are closed to use.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jim Grimsley Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Ginny Daley and Paula Jeannet
Additions processed by Elizabeth Arnold, 2003, Meghan Lyon, 2016, and Allie Poffinberger, 2019
Materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jim Grimsley is an author from Rocky Mount, NC, currently residing in Atlanta, GA.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains personal journals (1973-1993); personal and professional correspondence (1970s-2018); handwritten notebooks containing the creative beginnings of his novels and plays; datebooks and appointment journals; writing drafts (1970s-2016); published copies and galleys of his works, including translations; publicity, reviews, and publications by or about him in periodicals. Topics in his writings include family violence, homosexuality, the lives of young boys, racism and desegregation, and growing up in the Southern United States. The collection includes materials from all stages of Grimsley's creative process for his many plays, short stories, articles, and books. Grimsley's papers also include a significant amount of material from his work as an author of speculative and science fiction, including drafts of essays and books, editorial correspondence, and documentation of his participation in science fiction conventions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Spanish translation of Comfort and Joy; Editorial Egales, 2001.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials are closed to use. Use copies must be made in advance of a researcher's visit. Contact Research Services to request the production of access or listening copies. This restriction applies to materials in Box 30.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Science fiction story killed by Asimov. Includes galleys, Asimov's Forum thread about the incident. Story published in Subterranean.

did.unittitle: Surely Some Revelation is at Hand
The Physical Universe can be Transcended

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three different versions of Last Green Tree. The first folder is the Fist Printed Copy. The First Draft - Editor's Copy consists of the next 2 folders. The last 2 folders are the Copy Editor's Manuscript.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains complete manuscript folder, Early partial manuscript folder, Bound copy with draft and cover proof page, and a partial manuscript folder (2004)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Draft titles before final title include Good White People/Darkness and White. First two folders are typescript, followed by research materials (2014). The next two folders are typescript and typescript with edits. The final folder is a draft with edits for Darkness and White.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First folder is a working manuscript. Second folder is a manuscript notebook draft.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript excerpt folder (1982), and typescript folder (undated)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First two folders are Editor's Copy. Following three folders are Progress Print, probably the first complete manuscript. Next two folders are Progress Print, undated but smaller type indicates it is late in the book. A single folder is Early partial mansuscript. The last folder is Editor's Notes (2203).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Incomplete Screenplay, collaboration with Madeleine St.Roman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Adaptations by Eric Rosen (1998) and James Bolten (2001). Both are drafts, James Bolten script based on Jim Grimsley's novel.

did.unittitle: Bound galleys and published copies, various translations, of Grimsley's novels

A Bird of Prey audiovisual, including Biz Kids recordings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, student work, other university business
